column6: In this time of complete absence of traditional, well-polished RTS titles on the market, Grey Goo feels like a breath of fresh air. Following the classic C&C formula, it offers a welcome distraction from the more fast-paced, micromanagement-oriented games like COH and StarCraft. The campaign is actually pretty good, the story has a feel of a literary sci-fi novel to it. I like the interesting twist in faction design, with the humans being more high-tech and alien than the aliens themselves. The third faction, the Goo, is unlike any faction I've seen in any other RTS, and plays very differently compared to the other two. And of course, it wouldn't be a worthy successor to the C&C franchise if the soundtrack wasn't composed by Frank Klepacki. I definitely recommend this game to any C&C fan out there!

This is on the same level as Starcraft except the goo is relatively weak - overall I would wait for this game to go on special before buying. I was disappointed overall - would have liked to see a more intense storyline.

column6: This game is beautiful and runs great.  It was so much potential to be great, too bad the story in the campaign is so boring.  Why they decided to make these inspired cutscenes with awesome VA work; and NO STORY.  The story of this game is never properly explained, you are just thrust into the middle of it with hopes you will understand it.  I keep wanting to like this game, but I still haven't found a way to do that effectively.
